Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2013 11:56AM naturegirl11 wrote: I've been thinking of this tonight and reading through this forum. I found this quote below posted by another women, apparently wise in her recovery. She spoke about being present and appreciating the time we have, today. <3  I guess we never do know what tomorrow will bring. I'm going to spend time with the hubby and love up my dogs. The quote below seems worth sharing. Hugs to all, nature girl Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life...Look at the birds of the air...and consider the lilies of the field. And can any of you by worrying add a single hour to your span of life? Matthew 6:25-34
Posts.Title: Biopsy before or after the holiday? birad 4b, scared naturegirl11 Nora5

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2013 09:31AM naturegirl11 wrote: Thanks so much. I really needed to hear that. I've been waiting so long for the test that I am becoming quite depressed. Thanks for the reminder that there is recovery ms. phil! Bless you!
Posts.Title: Biopsy before or after the holiday? birad 4b, scared naturegirl11 Nora5

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2013 04:43AM naturegirl11 wrote: Thanks!! It helps me to not feel so alone for those who took the time to write. I'm trying my best to keep things in perspective. I think I has a sense of calmness about this last test since my last two screenings were essentially clear. I remember the day I found it. I had been out on the lake with my husband. When I came home and changed my hand just kind of went to the lump. I'd had regular breast exams. It seems like it came on suddenly. It's on the left outer side of my breast and kind of floats around. It is really more noticeable to me when I get close to my period, feels slightly painful and swollen. The three weeks after that I can't really feel pain or anything from it although it's still there. I've been worried ever since really I found it. I'm 46 and have older kids and at a point in my life of looking forward to focusing on myself as I have spent years raising kids, foster kids, my husband kids, and I work in social work and have 25 clients daily I am responsible for. I'm trying to figure out how I am going to put on a brave face though this. my husbands mom passed away from breast cancer when he was 19. My clients are pretty perceptive and can tell when something is wrong. I hope I can be brave. I'm trying to keep in mind that I still have decent odds of a benign result. I did question the radiologist and reminded him that the last test he was hesitant about following it diagnostically based on his earlier evaluation. He stated "well I'm glad you pushed for a follow-up". I guess that didn't make me feel to confident about him. I looked at my films. The are of concern essentially looked the same 6 months ago, just a lot lighter and maybe a bit smaller but it was there. The surgeon said it looks oddly cystish. I have cysts on my wrist and hands. I can only hope it's benign. I'm al;so thinking he reviews these well before his surgeries and that I can place some confidence in the fact that he thinks it doesn't really look like cancer to him. I'm trying. I've had fibromyalgia since I was 32, then a car accident where I injured my neck. I try to take good care of myself and really just wish for a break from medical stuff. I'm praying for that. I have literally looked at hundreds of ultrasound images comparing mine to them, trying not to obsess, can you relate? I live in a rural area, we do have a breast clinic but I am thinking of traveling a bit for a better facility with more specialists. I live in Michigan so any recommendations would be helpful. I have read than John Hopkins Breast Center will give you an initial insight on the pathology and have the results to you in 24 hours. I am also considering a facility that's willing to do an MRI or 3D mammogram between now and Christmas, just to get more information. Thanks so much for all who replied. It really helps to chat with women who are experiencing this. I felt pretty alone. Marie, I'm glad your results were benign, Star, I will be praying for good results for you. SLV58, keepthefaith & Susan, I am praying for good health for you and I appreciate the replies.
Posts.Title: Biopsy before or after the holiday? birad 4b, scared naturegirl11 Nora5

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 10:32AM naturegirl11 wrote: Hi Ladies, thanks for the reply. I am feeling so many ups and downs right now. My husband is taking me to a bigger, more specialized clinic tomorrow. I can agree with everyone that the waiting is horrible. Going through a range of emotions that are really intense. Either way I feel like this has been a wake up call for me. I'm doing some writing tonight of a list of things that I want to do, things I have put off, people who I want to see and haven't made time for. I think in the future regardless of how this goes for me I'm going to do things differently. Really makes me realize how precious our bodies are and what a gift life is. I picked up my films yesterday to take with me and have driven myself crazy looking at them, then looking at literally hundreds of Dr. Googles images. Probably a bad idea. My pictures look scary to me but there's no way to know what this is until the biopsy. In the meantime I guess there are no clear answers so I am trying to focus on all the other things it could be, they did give me a list of all the benign conditions at the clinic. It is mobile and does seem to shrink down a bit after my period. I am scared though because it is pretty big, 3cm at least. It started after I started taking a pre-menopausal supplement regularly. My hormones were low, entering menopause. I started the supplement called profema and then my hormones were tested again and the estrogen was up and it was back to normal. I even felt better, then the lump. Its been a bit over a year. I sure hope i didn't wait too long but just went by what the doctor said. If anyone needs prayers tonight I am here for you, tell me and they will be on the way. If you want to pray for me as well I will appreciate it. I really am scared. Sending hugs to all of you and thanking you for being here for me and for eachother. <3
Posts.Title: Biopsy before or after the holiday? birad 4b, scared naturegirl11 Nora5

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2013 10:20PM naturegirl11 wrote: Praying for you ! <3
Posts.Title: Results Tuesday 12/9 for Me Phillkri Phillkri

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2013 07:48AM naturegirl11 wrote: Thanks sarahjane, Yes I believe your right about how and when they tell you. Seems like until they see the tissue it's a lot of unknown. My husbands mother passed of BC, this is hitting so close to home. Bringing us closer together, though. As my friend said, stuff like this happens and all important stuff floats to the top, the less important seems to not matter. A wake up call either way. Thanks for the encouragement. I don't feel brave right now but am trying to dig deep. I'm going to try my best to bring in the new year thinking of good things.
Posts.Title: Have questions for the knowledgeable, stressing out pretty badly naturegirl11 edwards750

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2013 07:04PM naturegirl11 wrote: Thank you so much ladies. I just got back from town, my husband insisted he get me out of the house. Really felt a meltdown coming. I called my dr and she called in some Xanax. My bp is up so trying to breath. I had another appointment with the surgeon, while he is pretty concerned, he also says thinks my mass looks multi-cystic to him, wider than tall, ect, but who knows, nobody at this point. I'm trying so hard not to awful-ize this but I just don't know anyone with breast cancer, never thought I'd even have to think about it. I'm scared it's a death sentence. You are all so brave. I always thought I was until now. I'm not sure I can handle this. I live in a pretty isolated area, work too much and feel pretty alone, not much family support. Thank God I have my hubby. So much I still want to do in life, I hope I have the time and I hope the warrior woman in me wakes up here at some point. I've already had a lot of trauma in my life and was ready to enjoy middle age. Still hope for benign or some other odd thing, I'm trying to tell myself that but in the waiting there is a huge sense of doom. I'm sure many of you can relate. Love to all of you who responded and I'm praying for your wellness and happiness. Much love in return. <3
Posts.Title: Have questions for the knowledgeable, stressing out pretty badly naturegirl11 edwards750

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2013 07:23PM naturegirl11 wrote: ps...thanks Sarah Jane and Janet for sharing that about your lumps, wow, a bit of hope!!! When I found mine a year ago it was the size of an almond, now tripled. I did all I thought I was suppose to do and ultrasounds showed "normal breast tissue" even though you could feel the lump so they sent me away. In retrospect I would have had it removed or insisted on a biopsy, I just didn't have enough knowledge. That info is really the best I've heard in days so seriously, thank you!! Even a bit of hope now is a huge gift for me, even though I know I have to keep it in perspective. I love you ladies and I just smiled for the first time in three days! The day before Christmas eve I met with a radiologist. He told me to try to relax and enjoy Christmas, try not to put the cart ahead of the horse, but to be prepared that in could be the C word. How does one do all of that??  Impossible! Thanks lilly, moonflower & momand2kids & Marie. I was hoping my internet would shut down so I would be unable to continue to look at every ultrasound photo I could find online and compare it to my own trying to identify it!! I'm a researcher and obviously not much self control right now. My surgeon told me he had been looking at these things for 17 years and still couldn't tell... so I shouldn't try to become an expert in a couple weeks, lol! I have to write a grant and be done by tomorrow, hopefully I can focus on that and get it done. Thanks again for helping me feel not so alone in all this. The support here is unbelievable. Really the hardest thing I've been through yet in life...thanks for being here for me.
Posts.Title: Have questions for the knowledgeable, stressing out pretty badly naturegirl11 edwards750

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2013 07:34PM naturegirl11 wrote: Thanks Melissa, yes I need to remember those stats. the radiologist seemed to have no idea what it was, doesn't seem to fit any category and I've been worried because of the size of my lump, and the fact that I have fibromyalgia, or so they tell me. Head starts spinning about every ache and pain, and I read too many hard and very sad stories. I also probably should have had the biopsy done sooner.  I wanted to make it through the holidays in one piece. I have a bunch of disabled people at work who were counting on me for a big celebration. I guess I didn't put myself first. The waiting built up anxiety, day by day, especially now after the festivities and distractions are over.  By the way, I copied and pasted this quote from you from another thread into a note I could read regularly. I want you to know it has helped in moments of panic, here it is below:  Don't sweat it until you need to. Worrying never changed the outcome of anything, it just steals the joy from today. Lots of women come on these boards who literally make themselves sick for a month or more over something that turns out to be nothing. Try not to do that to yourself. I'm doing this to myself, just like you said, but with help from all of you it's bearable and I'm so glad I came across what you wrote. Thanks for the wisdom Melissa. <3
Posts.Title: Have questions for the knowledgeable, stressing out pretty badly naturegirl11 edwards750

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2014 10:10PM naturegirl11 wrote: Hi Anne, I was just talking to my mom, thank goodness I still have her. She said to me, "while your walking through life, put Faith in front of fear". That helped me, not sure if it will help you but I thought it was worth passing on. I'm praying for you to be able to walk in to your appointment tomorrow with faith that you will be taken care of. Just wanted to let you know that I'm thinking of you and hoping and praying for the best for you. <3
Posts.Title: I choose to wait... AnxietyAnne SchoolCounselor

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2013 09:18PM naturegirl11 wrote: I spoke to a nurse specialist today. What she said was "the proof is in the pudding", meaning until they get the biopsy/pathology results they really aren't for certain what they are looking at. I'm totally worried, too but until they know the biopsy results I won't have a real answer. Hang in there. Anxiety medicine helps. Sending positive thoughts your way.

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2014 04:33PM naturegirl11 wrote: Hi Stxchick, I want you to know that I am praying for you. I hope you can not drive yourself crazy with anxiety between now and your appointment and can fill your time with things you enjoy and pamper yourself. Big hugs, Nature Girl
Posts.Title: large solid mass right breast. Diagnostic mammogram in 10 days stxchick stxchick

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2013 07:01PM naturegirl11 wrote: Hi Foreveryours, I'm in the exact same boat, same rating, Birads4b, same deal, waiting to get through the holiday and a wreck with worry. Maybe it will help us to remember that a 4b is an intermediate suspicion. They're not sure. If they were more certain it was cancer it would be rated higher (4c, or 5). There are alot of strange things that it could be and from my research statistically its in the neighborhood of 70 - 80% chance that it is a benign finding based on your rating and the interpretation of the radiologist. I'm trying to listen to my own words here as well and it's really hard. I was blind-sided as well by my own experience. Keeping you in my thoughts. Glad you were able to have your test moved up. I've felt better when I keep busy and try to get on with life as normal, been praying alot.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy Appointment foreveryours foreveryours
